page.title: 01GLENLIVET
page.content: This beautiful area is on the banks of the rivers Avon and Livet which are renown for good salmon fishing. It was here that the first legal whisky distillery was built in 1822 and it is still in production. Two hotels cater for tourists who can visit the Reception Centre from where they are guided through the distillery before sampling 'The Glenlivet' whisky. The waste products from distilling are processed into animal feed at the drying plant beside the distillery. These two industries provide the major source of employment in the area. House for the workforce surround the distillery and nearby is the local Primary School, secondary pupils having to travel to Aberlour. There are no shops, just a Post Office, but vans come weekly with basic supplies. The surpunding countryside is farmed.
